title: Arc Furnace
content: The **Arc Furnace** is a machine used to remelt whole blocks into different or more pure materials ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the copper block as shown in building tutorial **Power Input:** On top of the coil **Power Consumption:** 16MW during operation ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/FT7tKqH ## Recipes To smelt blocks, place them inside the furnace {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Cobblestone |Magma Block |- |Stone |Magma Block |- |Magma Block |Lava |- |Wet Sponge |Sponge |- |Sand |Glass |- |T.N.T. |Diamond Block™ |- |Sculk Catalyst |Budding Amethyst |- |Sculk |Cobweb |- |Smooth Stone |Deepslate |- |Cobbled Deepslate |Gravel |- |Calcite |Quartz Block |- |Polished Deepslate |Basalt |- |Blackstone |Tuff |- |Raw Copper Block |Copper Block |- |Raw Gold Block |Gold Block |- |Raw Iron Block |Iron Block |} Composed by SonyXM4

title: Battery Array
content: The **Battery Array** is a machine. How do I put this in the WIP category lol ## Technicals Stores energy, and keeps it for long time

title: Crusher
content: The **Crusher** is a machine that squeezes items into dust using pistons. ## Technical **Multiblock Core Placement:** "the multiblock core goes in the bottom hopper, faces forwards" -Jona **Power Input:** Into the HVC Block **Power Consumption:** 10MW during operation **Activation:** Put the input item into the top Hopper. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Netherite Scrap | -> | Netherite Dust |- | Stone | -> | Cobblestone |- | Cobblestone | -> | Gravel |- | Gravel | -> | Sand |- | Wool | -> | 4x String |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Dust |- | Amethyst Block | -> | Amethyst Dust |- | Ice | -> | Snowball |- | Packed Ice | -> | 9x Snowballs |- | Bone | -> | 6x Bonemeal |- | Sugar Cane | -> | 2x Sugar |- | Blaze Rod | -> | 4x Blaze Powder |- | T.N.T. | -> | 5x Gunpowder |- | Redstone | -> | Red Dye |- | Raw Gold | -> | Gold Powder |- | Raw Gold Block | -> | 9x Gold Powder |- | Raw Iron | -> | Iron Powder |- | Raw Iron Block | -> | 9x Iron Powder |- | Raw Copper | -> | Copper Powder |- | Raw Copper Block | -> | 9x Copper Powder |- | Netherite Ingots | -> | 4x Netherite Powder |}

title: Diesel Generator
content: The **Diesel Generator** is a power-generating Multiblock in TERF. It constantly generates 6MW while the multiblock structure is [intact](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Multiblocks#Intactness). It has no stats or controls. The main purpose of Diesel Generators is to keep the facility operational while [the STFR](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [the DEM](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M) are offline, as well as during the aforementioned multiblocks' startup sequences. It can also be used as an alternative to a STFR or DEM in smaller bases. There are 4 Diesel Generators, placed back-to-back with the oxidised copper block part being [shared](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Multiblocks#Block_Sharing), in the TERF facility.

title: Electric Press
content: The **Electric Press** is used to press various items into other items ## Technicals **Mutliblock Core Placement:** Shown in Infobox image **Power Input:** Above top cut copper block **Power Consumption:** 1500 MWt every operation **Activation:** Each operation is activated by powering the piston ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | 1x Honeycomb | -> | 1x Slimeball |- | 1x Honeycomb Block | -> | 4x Slimeball |- | 8x String | -> | 1x Leather |- | 5x Blaze Powder | -> | 1x Blaze Rod |- | 1x Netherite Scrap | -> | 1x Ancient Debris |}

title: Electrolyzer
content: The **Electrolyzer** is a machine used to convert water into oxygen and hydrogen. <chem display#\"inline\">H2O -> 2H + O </chem> ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Please refer to the build tutorial **Power Input:** Conductor Block on the machine '''Power Consumption:'* *Unknown'' {| class\"wikitable\" !Input Fluid !Output 1 !Output 2 !Processing Time |- |Water 30mb |Hydrogen 20mb |Oxygen 10mb |100 ticks |} ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/gallery/electrolyzer-build-tutorial-LAmKmya The multiblock core block has been highlighted in green for clarity

title: Fabricator
content: The **Fabricator** is a machine used to fabricate most of TERF's custom items and tools. title: Hadron Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a machine in the TERF Facility, used to smash items into other items at high speeds to create new items. It is a major part of the [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process). ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards **Power Input:** Into the Interface as seen in tutorial video **Power Consumption(MW):** <math>Length \times 16</math> ## Build Tutorial

title: Large Fluid Solidifier
content:
The **Large Fluid Solidifier** is a machine that turns liquids, such as [Water](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Water), into blocks, such as [Ice](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Ice). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Lapis Block, facing towards the output conveyor belt. **Power Input:** Not needed. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Provide the machine with the correct amount of input liquid. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Fluid (amount mB) ! -> ! Output Block |- | [Water](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Water) (2,000 mB) | -> | Ice |- | [Mineral Magma](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Mineral_Magma) (2,000 mB) | -> | Coal Ore (~34.5%)
Copper Ore (~32.7%)
Redstone Ore (~13.5%)
Gold Ore (~9.70%)
Iron Ore (~3.25%)
Diamond Ore (~2.99%)
Lapis Ore (~2.91%)
Ancient Debris (0.3%) |- |}

title: Magma Drill
content: The **Magma Drill** is a machine that extracts Mineral Magma from Lava. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone. Orientation doesn't matter. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block. **Power Consumption:** 70MW **Activation:** Active by default. Deactivate by moving fluid output. ## Recipes The input structure is a list of blocks, which should be placed from top to bottom. Place the input structure directly below the drill bit, (lightning rod) or the drill bit directly above the input structure. {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Structure ! -> ! Output Fluid |- | 3 Blocks, Lava, Bedrock | -> | Mineral Magma |- |}

title: Mainframe
content: The **Mainframe** is a device used to link machines to each other. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone, facing towards the screens. **Power Input:** Not needed, despite the presence of HVC blocks. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Automatic, can be restarted by removing the multiblock core and adding it back again. ## Servers A Mainframe's usefulness depends on the number of connected servers. Each connected machine "consumes" servers through the mainframe. If you don't have enough servers to fufill the needs of all connected machines, the mainframe will crash, making a unique sound. The mainframe will then restart after 1 minute. To restart a mainframe sooner, remove the multiblock core and add it back again. Each mainframe starts with 2 servers, which are part of the multiblock structure. Additional servers can be added by placing L.O.O.M. servers above HVC blocks connected to the mainframe's own HVC blocks. HVC cables will not work for connecting servers to mainframes. L.O.O.M. servers can also be placed on top of other servers, making a server stack. Up to 3 servers can be in a single stack; additional servers are ignored and considered disconnected from the mainframe. ## Connection Machines can be connected to a Mainframe via [Data Connection](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Physical_Connections#Data_Connection)s. Data Connections are accepted through the waxed cut copper block, found at the bottom of the multiblock structure, as is common with machines that accept a data connection. ## Usage TBC

title: Mineral Magma
content: **Mineral Magma** is a custom liquid produced by [Magma Drill](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Magma_Drill)s.

title: OpenCore
content: The OpenCore is a furnace that uses two positron emission units to remelt items many times more efficiently than basic methods. Use of OpenCore can consume from 1000MWh to 10000MWh ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the iron blocks at the bottom **Power Input:** Into the conductor blocks ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/RC9NZsx Note than the upper part is 4 blocks above the bottom part ##Usage To use OpenCore you need active S.T.F.R which produces more than 500 MWh (Varies depending on the recipe) {| class="wikitable" !Ingredient !Energy (MWh) !Result |- |8x Netherite Scrap |5000 |8x Netherite Ingot |- | 32x Glowstone Dust |2000 |24x Blaze Powder |- |4x Emerald Block |7200 |3x Diamond Block |- | 20x Quartz |900 |20x Amethyst Shards |- |4x Amethyst Block |6000 |1x Ochre Froglight |- |1x Netherite Block |10000 |1x Heavy Core |} If you meet the requirements, you can start-up OpenCore and start using it. After confirming start-up sequence, you will start getting temperature "orders" you need to meet. You can find them at sign above centre of control panel. If you fail to meet order you will face consequences. If recipe was simple (froglight, amethyst shards, blaze powder) you will just get small explosion/photons, else, if there was difficult recipe (netherite ingots, diamond blocks, heavy core) you will get medium/large explosion. Full tutorial: https://youtu.be/xkQwBeZJXUA <small>''Written by LogicLogger''</small> <small>''Corrections & build tutorial by Sony''</small>

title: Physical Connections
content: Most machines will need some physical connection to other machines, whether it's electrical, fluidic or digital. ## Basic Behaviour All connections connect in the same way, using omnidirectional connecting blocks and directed connecting blocks * **Omnidirectional Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will input and output from any side * **Directed Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will only input or output from two opposite sides ## Types <gallery> File:ElectricWires.webp|Electric Cables File:HotFluidPipe.webp|Hot Fluid Pipe File:ColdFluidPipe.webp|Cold Fluid Pipe File:DataConnection.webp|Data Connection </gallery> ### Electrical Cables * Used to electrically connect machines * Transfers electric power ### Hot Fluid Pipe * Used to connect the S.T.F.R. and Turbines * Transports Steam and Mineral Magma ### Cold Fluid Pipe * Used to connect Coolant Pumps and Turbines to S.T.F.R. * Transports Coolant ### Data Connection * Used to connect control panels and multiblock machines, usually operated by a mainframe <sub>''<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>''</sub> __NOEDITSECTION__

title: Pressurizer
content: If the Pressurizer has oxygen it pressurizes an enclosed area ## Logistics **Multiblock core placement:** in the vent block on top, cut copper must be placed first, then the multiblock, then the vent block. {| class="wikitable" |+Fluid/Gas logistics: !Input fluid: !Storage capacity: |- |2mb of Oxygen/s |30mb of oxygen |}

title: Purifier
content: The **Purifier** is a machine that turns blocks into other blocks by bathing them in water. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the piston while facing the opposite direction that the piston is **Power Input:** Behind the piston **Power Consumption:** 5MW during operation **Activation:** Place the input blocks underneath the iron bars ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input ! -> ! Result |- | Stone | -> | Calcite |- | Basalt | -> | Blackstone |- | Red Sandstone | -> | Netherrack |}

title: Rolling Mill
content: The **Rolling Mill** is a machine used to roll ingots into plates. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** In the center of the multiblock structure, at the bottom, facing towards the output hopper. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block below the input hopper. **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation. **Activation:** Put the input item into the input hopper. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Iron Ingot | -> | Iron Plate |- | Copper Ingot | -> | Copper Plate |- | Netherite Ingot | -> | Netherite Plate |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Plate |- | Uranium Ingot | -> | Uranium Plate |- | Plutonium Ingot | -> | Plutonium Plate |- |}

title: Testing page (Do not touch)
content: The WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. ## Logistics: **Power consumption:** 10,000 MW/t per block. **Power storage:** 2,000,000 MW ## WarpCore Guide: Place the multiblock core in the WarpCore FACING the mainframe connection. The multiblock core for the panel goes facing towards the screens

title: The D.E.M
content: The D.E.M. is a black hole based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. # A massive warning that the info in the dem page is incorrect because it literally spreads misinformation ### Structure add a gallery when you get evenly square versions of the individual compopnents of the D.E.M. Component List of images to add * Proper Square Full Render * Core * Horizon Scrubber * Power Laser * Power Extractors * Stabilizer * Startup Manifold (Only if its easy to get) #### Core * This is the black hole core of the D.E.M. where hawking radiation for power generation comes from * This is only present while the D.E.M. is in operations, or as a ball of compressed matter during startup, which then gets compressed by gravitational amplification * The core is kept stable using a gravity shield that prevents the gravity of the black hole from extending past intended boundaries * The core is generally being orbited by the accretion disc, which is the disc of matter falling into the core to generate power, this disc can stall if complete desaturation is allowed, but the accretion disc can simply be reformed #### Horizon Scrubber * Prevents the atmosphere inside the room from reaching into the accretion disc, which would uncontrollably saturate the disc, potentially destabilizing the gravity shield by throwing core parameters out of control * It does not prevent anything from falling into it, allowing the accretion disc to be resaturated during operations using any form of matter #### Power Lasers * Stabilizes one part of the D.E.M.'s Operation, wether it'd be the accretion disc's rotational energy or thermal energy, or causing EMR flux in the core or feeding it some mass #### Power Extractors * Extracts power from the core using the emitted hawking radiation, due to how accelerated the hawking radiation decay process is, this generates a lot of power #### Stabilizers * Stabilizes the gravitational shield, preventing the black hole from tearing the facility and the planet apart #### Startup Manifold * Generates the accretion disc ### Operation Parameters #### Global Laser Offset * Offsets the lasers from the singularity of the core, eventually changing their modes across 4 different overall modes # Extremely Low Offset: Feeds the singularity directly, slightly increasing core mass # Low Offset: Enters the EMRIRS Without hitting the singularity, causing superradiant scattering within the EMRIRS and eventually exiting back out as EMR Flux # Medium Offset: Low leverage on the accretion disc, warming it up more than it adds rotational energy to it # High Offset: High leverage on the accretion disc, adding rotational energy more than it warms it up #### Global Power Laser * Acts as a general multiplier to the effect of the current laser offset's mode #### EMRIR Shield Density * Increases EMR Flux ** This would increase the accretion disc temperature based on how high this gets ** This decreases the gravity shield's stress based on how high this gets #### Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage * Decreases Accretion Disc Saturation ** This decreases core spin due to having less matter to fall into the core *** This is also based on how fast the disc is spinning * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Field Compression Control * Increases hawking radiation by reducing core mass ** This increases power generation * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Electron Injection * Increases Reactor Charge ** This causes higher disc de-saturation ** This causes lightning bolt strike if get too high ( 9000-12000 ) ## Crucial Components Missing: Proper & Square D.E.M. Control Panel Image <gallery> File:Mainframe.webp|The Main Computer </gallery> ### Control Panel * Used to operate the D.E.M. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network <sub>First Edition Composed by loltnt_pvp</sub> ## Trivia # The D.E.M.'s full name is \"Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor\", SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR For short. ## Related Links Cooocki and FJSAGS have put together some notes on how D.E.M. works: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JwTdfeakhBpCm71j09fPvbVEmozJ9vUW4yS5e0n3jAc?tab=t.0

title: The S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R. is a fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility ### <big>Structure</big> <gallery> File:STFRrender.webp|The S.T.F.R. File:STFRCaseRender.webp|The encasing superstructure of S.T.F.R. File:Area render 11 .webp|The core of S.T.F.R. during operation File:StabiliserRender.webp|One of six S.T.F.R. stabilisers </gallery>The S.T.F.R. consists of 6 stabilisers, an encasing superstructure and the main core #### Core * This is the core of fusion reaction, where the main processes happen * This core is only present inside the superstructure when the reactor is in operation * The core consists of a shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core * The shield layer consists of one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields #### Case * The encasing superstructure is a sphere-like structure around the core of the reactor * As the core generates heat during operation, the heat is transferred to the case, where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines to generate power #### Stabilisers * The stabilisers play a crucial role in keeping the core in a stable state and preserving the integrity of core shields ## Crucial Components <gallery> File:BreakersRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Electrical Breakers File:CoolantPumpRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Coolant Pump File:ControlPanel.webp|S.T.F.R. Control Panel File:SteamTurbine.webp|Steam Turbine </gallery> ### Breakers * The breakers supply the S.T.F.R. with DC current * The__INDEX__y are only needed during startup or restabilisation * AC current is input at the bottom conductor; DC is output from the top conductor ### Coolant Pump * This pump pumps the coolant for the S.T.F.R. ### Control Panel * Used to operate the S.T.F.R. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network ### Turbine and generator * Upon heating up the [https://terf.fandom.com/wiki/The_S.T.F.R#Case reactor case], steam is produced and can be directed into turbines to generate power * Turbines have to be connected with steam pipes to the S.T.F.R. * Turbines have to be connected with coolant pipes to the S.T.F.R. <sub>''<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>''</sub>

title: WarpCore
content: ToDo: Layer by Layer build tutorial - SonyXM4 WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. It is inspired by \"The Spire\" from Portal: Revolution. ## Building The main challenge of building WarpCore is getting 32 netherite blocks. Everything else is obtainable from the storage. ## Full Resource List * **Netherite**: **32 Blocks** (see [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process)) * **Copper Coils** * **Ancient Debris** * **High Voltage Conductor Slabs** * **High Voltage Conductor Walls** * **Iron Bars** * Decorated pots * Whatever you need for an actual ship ## Usage FJSAGS and Cooocki have put together a guide on using the WarpCore: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19_ZigixmATimn0WH8QtrK6JksQ0ANh6BGBIhi3rnqlc/edit?usp#drivesdk ## Known WarpCores {| class\"wikitable\" ! Name ! Known Operators ! Status ! Status Date |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Cooocki, Jona | In possession of Jona | 22nd June, 2025 |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Ragn4Rockx | Destroyed. Cause: The shot of ART hit the core(s), which led to destabilization and explosion. | 20th March, 2025 |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Ronan | Unknown | 11th April, 2025 |- | \"Neotheater\" | Tobias, Cooocki, FJSAGS, LogicLogger | Destroyed. Cause: Failure when attempting to repair after a meteorite hit. | 20th March, 2025 |- | \"OK Orchestra (3rd edition)\" | Tobias, Cooocki (partially), FJSAGS, LogicLogger | Destroyed. Cause: ART shot in overworld | 16th April 2025 |- | \"Quasar\" | Corrstud | Bomboclat | 8th June 2025 |- | \"Aurora\" | | Adidas | 17th August 2025 |- |}

title: Wet Mill
content: This machine is used to pulverize fine crushed materials into very fine dust ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the pot **Power Input:** In the Conductor Block **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation **Fluid Extraction:** Fluids are extracted below the decorated pot via. copper pipes **Cauldrons:** The cauldrons have to be full of water ## Recipes Items are inserted into the input hopper {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Gold Dust |Gold Slurry |- |''More recipes'' |''Soon'' |} Composed by SonyXM4

title: C.R.R.
content:
## Description The Catalyzed Redstone Reactor or C.R.R. is an addon to the TERF datapack. Designed to be the second reactor after the [M.C.F.R.](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/MCFR) utilizing the Helium-4 that it produces. It is a Matter Conversion Reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. The C.R.R. has three different parts, the Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and the Projector. You will need to constantly add Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls to the C.R.R. to keep it operational. ## C.R.R. Operations To begin the startup process, you will need to input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB of Helium-4 into the C.R.R. Be aware, there can be a 5% chance for the C.R.R. to potentially have a Startup Failure. The controls below describes what they affect. Saturation Extraction Rate - The rate that the Energy Collector extracts Saturation
Catalyzer Injection - Increases C. Catalyzer
™B Projection - Reduces Shield Stress by using up more F. Shield ## Emergency Operations ### Meltdown Core Temperature will increase the C.R.R.'s Shield Stress. If the Shield Stress reaches above 100%, it will begin to degrade the shield. Increasing Saturation Extraction Rate and decreasing Catalyzer Injection may help to decrease stress. You can also use Catalyzer Annihilation to decrease Saturation.
If you also run out of F. Shield, this will also cause the shield to degrade.
Once the shield breaks, this begins the process of the second stage of meltdown. You will need to perform restabilization before the C.R.R. reaches stage three meltdown. You will need to input water into the C.R.R., activate Catalyzer Annihilation, and injecting reaction inhibitor, once these are completed it will proceed to shut down the C.R.R.
If you fail to input water and use the Catalyzer Annihilation, the C.R.R. will reach stage three meltdown, it is best to evacuate the area as the core is unable to be saved. The C.R.R. will begin to leak out rays that can injure personnel and damage the area around it. After a while, the reactor will blow up and leave behind a crater. ### Stall If you run out of C. Redstone or have 0% saturation, the reactor may begin to stall. Unlike the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR), this will not lead to the reactor freezing. It will then give you two options: remove the key and shut down the reactor or reignite the reactor again. ### Startup Failure There is a 5% change for startup failure to occur. If this does happen, this will start to cause the shield to form unstable, to prevent the C.R.R. from summoning a Resonance Cascade, you will need to kill the green particles that fly around the room. Once they have been all removed, the C.R.R. will return to normal operation. ## C.R.R. Logistics There is no limit for Core Temp but the higher it goes, the more Shield Stress is gained. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, and Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer when it is low. ## Trivia The C.R.R. was inspired by the Anti Mass Spectrometer from the Half-Life series and the Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod.
